How do you explain the Schlieffen Plan, huh??

Germany certainly did NOT "wander" into Belgium, although they did in Luxembourg. It was all part of the Schlieffen Plan.

It is pretty obvious he knew a war was coming, but he did nothing to prevent it.

Also, the triple alliance is further evidence, quite obviously a retaliation to the Triple entente.

The brits at no point whatsoever viewed Germany as a potential ally, because aligning with Germany would leave them against France, a foe they didn't want.

The triple entente is yet more evidence: if you look at the nations on a map, they surround Germany. That means they wanted to be able to defend.

I could point out the deployment of German Armies along the Western front days before war was declared but I think my work here is done.
Beale, Break out the Popcorn. This is going to get Interesting.

Careful guys. This is getting pretty far off topic. Besides the fact Beale's parts are Soviet spacecraft replicas, there's nothing here to be discussed that deals with World history, politics, or potential causes for WWI which is a massive rabbit hole.

Beale! Personally, I think racks would be cooler, and a bit truer to the OG ATV. Cardboard is cute, but totally impractical, but also totally Kerbal if that's what you're going for. Racks on all four sides with a cardboard box or two hanging about would be neat. I think however you decide to do it, you need a bread box to store your precious sentient space-bread.

Anyway, guys, don't be silly. Second Empire is not only WWI, it's also almost a half of 19 century and several years before WWI. I had myself space stations "Koenig", "Bismark" (for unification of Germany) and an ATV-based vehicle "Himmelwagen" (oldfags may remember my screenshots of Koenig + Himmelwagen) and so on.
